title: Irish Spiced Fruitcake
ingredients: 1 1/2cups mixed dried fruit, such as golden raisins, currants, and raisins
3/4cup demerara sugar or other raw sugar
directions: 1. Put all the ingredients apart from the flour and eggs into a saucepan and mix well. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring continuously. Reduce the heat slightly and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and let cool for about 30 minutes.
2. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F. Grease and line a deep 8-inch cake pan.
3. Add the flour and eggs to the cake batter, mixing well to combine. Spoon the batter into the prepared pan, leveling the surface with a wet spatula.
4. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Reduce the oven temperature to 325°F and bake for an additional 1 1/2 hours, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
5. Let the cake cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then invert onto a wire rack and let cool completely.
